page.title: 10TRADITIONS
page.content: Some customs are still kept. Visiting of neighbours on the first of January,'FIRST FOOTING' soon after midnight involves taking a gift of food or drink and a lump of coal to ensure a plentiful supply throughout the ensuing year. On the last day of term nearest to Easter primary school children in Deanston look for,and always find, Easter eggs left by the 'Easter Bird' in the playpark. At local weddings coins are scattered in the street by the Groomsman and the children watching SCRAMBLE to pick them up. A young man of the farming community about to be married is given a 'blackening' the night before his wedding by his friends. They cover him in chocolate, cocoa, treacle, or even sheep dip. Friends? GUISING is popular at Hallowe'en.
